HL7 Standard.summary: This Implementation Guide (IG) focuses on electronic case reporting (eCR) using FHIR. It heavily relies on FHIR for its core structure and operations, defining FHIR profiles, extensions, and transactions for eICR, RR, and eRSD. While it acknowledges CDA through its relationship with previous CDA-based IGs, it doesn't actively utilize CDA structures. The IG doesn't use v2 or v3 directly. It demonstrates a degree of cross-paradigm awareness by referencing the relationship to prior CDA work and aiming for future alignment with the US Public Health Library.

Geographic Scope.summary: This Implementation Guide focuses on electronic case reporting (eCR) within the United States. It defines FHIR-based transactions for the electronic Initial Case Report (eICR), the Reportability Response (RR), and the electronic Reporting and Surveillance Distribution (eRSD), covering all reportable conditions across all jurisdictions within the United States. It leverages US Core profiles and is designed for the US healthcare ecosystem.

Domain Focus.summary: This FHIR Implementation Guide focuses on automating electronic case reporting (eCR) from Electronic Health Records (EHRs) to Public Health Agencies (PHAs). It defines FHIR-based transactions for the electronic Initial Case Report (eICR), the Reportability Response (RR), and the electronic Reporting and Surveillance Distribution (eRSD). The IG heavily emphasizes public health use cases, clinical data exchange for reporting, and workflow automation for reporting processes. It also incorporates elements of clinical knowledge for defining reporting rules and guidelines.

Implementation Approach.summary: This IG focuses on automating electronic case reporting (eCR) using FHIR. It heavily relies on Data Profiles to define the structure of eICR and RR documents, and Terminology to specify relevant code systems and value sets. REST APIs and Messaging are both supported for transport. The eRSD uses a constrained PlanDefinition, leveraging aspects of Decision Support to distribute reporting rules. Documents are central to the eICR and RR exchange.

Implementers.summary: This Implementation Guide focuses on automating electronic case reporting (eCR) from EHRs to Public Health Agencies. Therefore, EHR and Public Health Systems are the primary implementers. Clinical Decision Support systems play a role in triggering and processing reports. Other systems have limited or no involvement.

Users & Stakeholders.summary: This FHIR Implementation Guide (IG) primarily focuses on automating electronic case reporting (eCR) between healthcare providers and public health agencies. Therefore, Public Health Agencies are the core users, as the IG is designed to improve the timeliness, completeness, and accuracy of data they receive. Clinical Care Teams are also key users, as they are responsible for generating the eICR and integrating the RR into their workflows. Government Agencies have a significant influence, as they set reporting requirements and oversee public health programs. Healthcare Administrators play a role in implementing and managing the systems involved. Payers and Research Organizations have minimal involvement in the core functionality defined by this IG. Patients and Caregivers are indirectly impacted by improved public health surveillance but are not direct users of the IG.
